title: Looks like the Riot Balance team has taken a month long holiday break
body: Not a peep in almost a month in terms of game health/balance discussion.

This game has angered me to no end and yet I still fucking play. I've been here since season 2 and these past 2 seasons have been absolutely horrid in terms of overall game enjoyment (if only for myself) High base damage champs that are not juggernauts are building one or 2 damage items and assassinating people like it's what they were designed to do.

I've lived through ap Yi.
I've witnessed the horror that was 6 sunfire twitch.
I stood by and slit my wrists while I watched league of cleavers take over the rift.
I begrudgingly accepted the Veigar rework even though I still like his "rework" He's still not my old Veigar.
And now I'm living through the tank assassination/bot feed meta....Fuck me.

Been here since S2. 
Left a few months after Retcon.
Here I am again now, even as angry as I am.

I've just accepted that I'll never be able to take League seriously. I'll never buy anything from Riot, and I'll do my best to stand back and laugh whenever they do something horrendously stupid, over and over again. Instead of a serious hobby, I'm just going to consider it an internationally-known joke that Riot Games is terrible and still operates like an indie company that doesn't know what it's doing.

It's almost like they have lives outside of this game and the most celebrated holiday in the world was going on...

Yeah wow, its almost like these people want to enjoy Christmas + New Year with their friends and family rather than listen to us shitfuck their game to shreds for a few weeks. 

In all seriousness, we knew patch 6.24 was the last of 2016 because they said so in the patch update. The next patch is 7.1, and some decent changes are coming.
Riots balancing team has been gone since s2. All they do is nerf 20 fotms every couple of months the change the meta because they have no vision on what the game should be.

And? They put out a hot fix to tide us over.

More importantly, they aren't paid to come on here and respond to our angry anecdotal nonsense posts. They do that because they want us to feel like they're listening. It's not part of their jobs and every time they do they run the risk of someone using what they say in one specific situation to complain about a different stance that a different Rioter takes five months later. 

Really, a month off is so little for them to ask.

I understand it's the Christmas holidays and people deserve time off to be with their families and such, but an entire month without meaningful discussion about the state of the game is really troubling. Preseason is all about shaking up balance and following up on changes. This preseason we've seen virtually no follow up changes or even discussions about what was implemented in Season 7. Here are a list of things that Season 7 has introduced that haven't been balanced or even discussed for this entire month.

1) The assassin "rework" has been a failure. Currently the entire class is MIA outside of {{champion:7}} {{champion:107}} and {{champion:55}}. The rest of the class is unplayable with how easy it is to mitigate damage with exhaust/heals/shields.

2) The jungle is completely out of whack. Diversity is at an all time low. Can you keep up with {{champion:64}} clear speed and gank pressure? If so you can be played! If not? Well sucks to suck.

3) 5 man bot lane dives 8ish minutes into the game was a rare sight in LCS at one point, now it happens in virtually all of my games at gold/plat elo. First bot lane to back = auto lose lane and you instantly start the inevitable snowball. (First turret gold is bullshit)

4) top lane is an absolute mess. There is no reason for the jungler to head top. Top lane currently just waits for a fight to break out bot lane and TP down for hopefully a teamfight win that snowballs into a first turret + dragon. Rift Herald is just terrible. Takes too long to take and the buff is meh.

5) redemption + locket has virtually killed the assassin class for how strong and easy the damage mitigation is to activate. Op as hell and still 0 riot discussion on it.

6) Caitlyn has sat at a 53% winrate for most of the preseason with a 30% playrate. Still no nerfs in sight as she currently is killing bot lane diversity.

I could name a couple more but it's depressed me. My point is though that even if we are on break, there's no reason to at least have a couple of red posts here and there over the break discussing balance. The game is currently not balanced and has introduced a lot of game health issues that I think are worth discussing.
